intro: Podosemum virginicum, commonly known as the Virginia podosemum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Podosemum virginicum is typically found in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and along stream banks.
